description: Future teachers identify and acquire skills to serve exceptional students more
effectively in the general education classroom.  Students read and discuss to expand their
knowledge of the broad spectrum of resources available for students with disabilities,
second language learners, and those labeled "at-risk."  Historical perspectives as well
as inclusion, collaboration, curriculum development, and other current topics are
included. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: EDUC 290 or permission of instructor.
